p: A total of 38 compounds were identified by gas chromatography-mass spectrometry (GC-MS) analysis of the volatile oil of Cichorium glandulosum Boiss et Huet (CG) ( Table 1). The detected compounds accounted for 98.058% of the total amount. The total ion chromatogram obtained is shown in Figure 1. Terpenoids were the most abundant compounds. The relative content of citronellol was 74.060%, which peaked at 37.039 min. The structure and mass spectrogram of citronellol are shown in Figure 2A. Citronellol, or dihydrogeraniol, derived from lemongrass can be used as an antibacterial agent.
